00062     {
00063         global $Re_Ip;
00064 
00065         if ($this->ParseSyslogLine($logline, $cols)) {
00066             $re_user= '((invalid user\s+|)(\S+))';
00067             $re_clientip= "($Re_Ip)";
00068             $re_num= '(\d+)';
00069             $re_type= '(.*)';
00070 
00071             // Failed password for invalid user soner from 81.215.105.114 port 27836 ssh2
00072             // Failed password for root from 81.215.105.114 port 29782 ssh2
00073             // Failed none for invalid user soner from 81.215.105.114 port 40401 ssh2
00074             $re= "/Failed\s+(.*)\s+for\s+$re_user\s+from\s+$re_clientip\s+port\s+$re_num\s+$re_type$/";
00075             if (preg_match($re, $logline, $match)) {
00076                 $cols['Reason']= $match[1];
00077                 $cols['User']= $match[4];
00078                 $cols['IP']= $match[5];
00079                 $cols['Type']= $match[7];
00080             }
00081             else {
00082                 // Accepted password for root from 81.215.105.114 port 47179 ssh2
00083                 // Accepted publickey for root from 81.215.105.114 port 58402 ssh2
00084                 $re= "/Accepted\s+(.*)\s+for\s+$re_user\s+from\s+$re_clientip\s+port\s+$re_num\s+$re_type$/";
00085                 if (preg_match($re, $logline, $match)) {
00086                     $cols['User']= $match[4];
00087                     $cols['IP']= $match[5];
00088                     $cols['Type']= $match[7];
00089                 }
00090             }
00091             return TRUE;
00092         }
00093         return FALSE;
00094     }

Openssh::GetFileLineCount ( $  file,
$  re = '' 
)

Gets line count of file.

Parameters:
[in] $file string Log file pathname
[in] $re string Regexp to get count of a restricted result set
Returns:
int Line count

Warning:
Input redirection is necessary, otherwise wc adds file name to its output too

Here is the call graph for this function:

Openssh::GetLiveLogs ( $  file,
$  count,
$  re = '' 
)

Gets logs for live logs pages.

Used to extract lines in last section of the log file or of the lines grep'd.

Difference from the archives method is that this one always gets the tail of the log or grepped lines.

Parameters:
[in] $file string Log file
[in] $count int Tail lenght, page line count
[in] $re string Regexp to restrict the result set
Returns:
serialized Log lines

Reimplemented from Model.
